result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Cristiano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Cristiano

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Income Withholding
Five Star Fabricating - $50.00 biweekly for a total of $1133.00.
Amended to $1483.00  Felony Charge - $250 for DNA.
$1,433.00  Failure to pay, civil judgment.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Corrigall.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes $750 fine plus costs; DNA sample ordered; deft to pay $200 DNA surcharge, 30 DPT costs or civil judgment; firearms warning given.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Corrigall.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 6/8/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.  Court orders deft to submit DNA sample, Deputy transported deft from court to submit sample.
And response to discovery demand - filed by Atty K Corrigall.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Corrigall.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Corrigall requests adjournment of trial til after co-deft's marriage date and also due to his schedule, wants more time to prepare.  Court grants adjournment of JS from 12/1/14 at 9am to 4/6/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
Jury selection on December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on November 13, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
In limine; filed by ADA R Delgado.
Of intent to use sex 904.04(2) - "other acts" evidence at trial - filed by ADA R Delgado.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA R Delgado
State's proposed jury instructions - filed by ADA R  Delgado.
State's tice regarding deft's prior criminal conviction - filed by ADA R Delgado

With Atty Corrigall and ADA Phan the JSH of 9/4/14 at 1:15pm and JS of 9/22/14 at 9am are rescheduled, to be held on ADA Phan's week; Jury Status reset to 11/13/14 at 1:15pm; jury selection on 12/1/14 at 9:00am.
Filed by   Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.
State's notice of deft's statements - filed by:  Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.
State's motions in limine; filed by ADA J Hinshaw.
Jury selection on September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on September 4, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Corrigall.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 9/4/14 at 1:15pm and JS 9/22/14 at 9am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Corrigall.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Corrigall acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 6/20/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 7/3/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael A. Cristiano

Prior: 3215 86th Place, Kenosha, WI 53142
No contact with Patricia R. or her residence; Miss Pole 8501 - 75th St., Pleasant Prairie, WI. No discussion of this case with Jennifer J.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Kevin Corrigall. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 5-12-14 @ 8:15am. State to file information within statutory time limits. Atty. Corrigall has filed a bond motion and argues for bond modification. State opposes modification. Bond modified to allow no discussion of this case with Jennifer J. All other conditions and amount remain the same.

to Preliminary Hearing

119pm
  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kevin Corrigall.  Clerk NJ.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 4/17/14 @ 9am.  $5000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
